title.native: 学戦都市アスタリスク 2

description:
Second season of Gakusen Toshi Asterisk.

Less than a century ago a meteor collided with the planet's surface and the resulting disaster caused the next generation of humanity to develop a wide variety of amazing abilities. In the center of the meteor's crater lies Rikka, a system of six academies known as the Asterisk. Ayato Amagiri enters the Asterisk as a transfer student hoping to compete in a special battle event known as the Festa. However, he quickly finds himself on the bad side of one of the strongest fighters around—the beautiful but fiery Julis-Alexa von Riessfeld. To stand against her he'll have to rely on his own sword-wielding ability, but when the tables turn, will they be able to team up to take down the competition?

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
[Website](https://haruka-chisuga.net/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/chisuga-haruka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chisugaofficial)

Haruka Chisuga is the Grand Prix winner of the singer class of "Miss MACROSS 30 Contest".
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/setoken) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/瀬藤健嗣)

Started of with photography work, soon switched to directing.

**[Website](https://exina.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/EXiNA_XiENA)** | **[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/exinaofficial/)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/shiena-nishizawa/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/exina_xiena/)** | **[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKUR1GWKBZbFByLoPeRxDtA)** | **[Artist Page (Flying Dog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A024998.html)**

**Introduction:**
Shiena Nishizawa, alternatively known by stage name EXiNA, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer. She debuted under record label flying DOG after winning the grand prize at the label's first audition, she is now under record label [SACRA MUSIC](http://sacramusic.jp/artist/) (which is under Sony Music Entertainment).

**Biography:**
In junior high school, she became immersed in music when she received her father's guitar as a gift. She dreamed that one that she would sing in front of a large number of people as an artist, and in 2014 she won the grand prize at the "First flying DOG Audition". In 2015 she performed the ending theme song to the TV anime *"[Kantai Collection: Kancolle](https://anilist.co/anime/20553/Kantai-Collection-KanColle)"*, which was also her debut as a musician. 

Shiena announed a solo project on July 9, 2019, going from using her real name Shiena Nishizawa to adopting a new stage name EXiNA (which is an anagram of her given name Shiena = EXiNA). Her first release as EXiNA was a digital single released on July 10, 2019 titled 'EQ'. She went on to release a second digital single on August 3, 2019 titled 'KATANA', and then followed-up by releasing her third single on August 14, 2019 titled 'OVERTHINKING BOY'. Her first mini-album was released on August 21, 2019 titled 'XiX', which was also her first album-like release under her new stage name.

(Source: [generasia.com](http://www.generasia.com/wiki/Nishizawa_Shiena) | [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%A5%BF%E6%B2%A2%E5%B9%B8%E5%A5%8F), edited)

name.native: ラスマス・フェイバー

node.description:
[Website](https://rasmusfaber.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Rasmus_Faber) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rasmusfaber/)

Rasmus Faber is a music artist from Stockholm, Sweden. He is a pianist, DJ, remixer, composer, record producer, sound engineer and founder of the record label Farplane Records. He is mostly active in the electronic dance music genre, but also ventures into a wide variety of other musical styles. Rasmus performs solo as a DJ and pianist, and live with his band the RaFa Orchestra.

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.
**Morioka Kenichi** is a Japanese art and set designer, who also does design work.
